Senate File 2091 - Introduced


                                 SENATE FILE 

                                 SENATE FILE 
                                 SENATE FILE                                  SENATE FILE                                  BY  CHELGREN

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act providing education savings grants for pupils attending
  2    a nonpublic school or receiving competent private
  3    instruction, establishing an education savings grant fund,
  4    providing an income tax exemption, making appropriations,
  5    providing penalties, and including applicability provisions.
  6 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 5674XS (3) 87
    md/jh

PAG LIN



  1  1    Section 1.  Section 256.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3

  1  1    Section 1.  Section 256.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3    

  1  1    Section 1.  Section 256.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3    
  1  1    Section 1.  Section 256.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  1    Section 1.  Section 256.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding
  1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  2 the following new subsection:
  1  3      1  3      1  4 for an education savings grant pursuant to section 257.11B,
  1  5 including application processing timelines and information
  1  6 required to be submitted by a parent or guardian.
  1  7    Sec. 2.    1  5 including application processing timelines and information
  1  6 required to be submitted by a parent or guardian.
  1  7    Sec. 2.    1  6 required to be submitted by a parent or guardian.
  1  7    Sec. 2.    1  7    Sec. 2.    1  8 program.
  1  9    1.  a.  For the school budget year beginning July 1, 2019,
  1 10 and each succeeding school budget year, the following resident
  1 11 pupils who are attending a nonpublic school, as defined
  1 12 in section 285.16, or who are receiving competent private
  1 13 instruction under chapter 299A shall be eligible to receive an
  1 14 education savings grant in the manner provided in this section:
  1 15    (1)  A pupil eligible to enroll in kindergarten.
  1 16    (2)  A pupil eligible to enroll in grade one through grade
  1 17 twelve if the pupil has attended a public school for the
  1 18 equivalent of the two immediately preceding semesters for which
  1 19 the educational savings grant is requested and if the pupil is
  1 20 not otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 21    (3)  A pupil who received an education savings grant for
  1 22 the immediately preceding school budget year, who is eligible
  1 23 to enroll in grade one through grade twelve, and who is not
  1 24 otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 25    b.  Education savings grants shall be made available to
  1 26 requesting parents and guardians of an eligible pupil each
  1 27 school budget year for the duration of the education savings
  1 28 grant period and in the manner authorized under subsection
  1 29 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  1 30 expenses as provided in this section.
  1 31    c.  For purposes of this subsection, "resident" means the
  1 32 same as defined in section 282.1.
  1 33    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  1 34 which the education savings grant is first requested or the
  1 35 school year following expiration of a previous education
  2  1 savings grant period, the parent or guardian of the pupil
  2  2 requesting to receive an education savings grant shall submit
  2  3 an application to the department of education, on application
  2  4 forms developed by the department, indicating that the parent
  2  5 or guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school
  2  6 or place the pupil under competent private instruction as
  2  7 provided for in chapter 299A.
  2  8    (2)  In addition to such information deemed appropriate by
  2  9 the department of education, the application shall require
  2 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the pupil's
  2 11 enrollment for the following school year or a statement
  2 12 indicating the parent or guardian's intent to place the pupil
  2 13 under competent private instruction for the following school
  2 14 year.
  2 15    b.  An application from the parent or guardian of an
  2 16 eligible pupil shall be approved for the duration of the
  2 17 education savings grant period. Upon submission of a valid
  2 18 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil,
  2 19 the department of education shall enter into a contract with
  2 20 the parent or guardian requiring provision and funding of the
  2 21 education savings grant for each school budget year of the
  2 22 education savings grant period for which the pupil remains
  2 23 eligible under the requirements of this section.  The education
  2 24 savings grant period is five years or the number of years until
  2 25 completion of the school year during which the pupil graduates
  2 26 from high school or completes an equivalent level of competent
  2 27 private instruction under chapter 299A, whichever is less,
  2 28 provided that the parent or guardian may terminate the contract
  2 29 at any time.
  2 30    c.  By March 1 preceding each school year, the department
  2 31 of education shall notify the department of management of the
  2 32 number of pupils designated for the following school year
  2 33 to receive an education savings grant and the amount of the
  2 34 education savings grant for each pupil.  The department of
  2 35 education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3  1 pupils who are approved to receive an education savings grant.
  3  2    3.  a.  The department of management shall assign each
  3  3 pupil an education savings grant in an amount equal to the
  3  4 difference between eighty=seven and five=tenths percent of the
  3  5 regular program state cost per pupil and the statewide average
  3  6 foundation property tax per pupil for the same school year.
  3  7    b.  The department of management shall on July 1 following
  3  8 the determination of the amount of the education savings grant
  3  9 for each approved pupil transfer such amounts to the pupil's
  3 10 account in the education savings grant fund established under
  3 11 subsection 4.  Such amount shall be available to the pupil's
  3 12 parent or guardian in the manner authorized under subsection
  3 13 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  3 14 expenses incurred by such persons for the pupil during that
  3 15 school year or in a future school year pursuant to subsection
  3 16 5, paragraph "c".
  3 17    4.  An education savings grant fund is created in the state
  3 18 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 19 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department of
  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  3 31 administration of the fund.
  3 32    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  3 34    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings
  4  2 grants in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that
  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 17    b.  A nonpublic school or a provider of competent private
  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.
  4 23    c.  Moneys remaining in a pupil's account upon conclusion
  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.
  4 29    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  4 30 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  4 31 textbooks, fees or payments for educational therapies,
  4 32 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  4 33 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific subject
  4 34 matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic online
  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils
  5  1 with disabilities, including the cost of paraprofessionals
  5  2 and assistants who are trained in accordance with state law,
  5  3 standardized test fees, fees required by the department not to
  5  4 exceed for each grant recipient five percent of the total grant
  5  5 amount in any fiscal year, higher education costs, as defined
  5  6 in section 12D.1, excluding room and board expenses, and other
  5  7 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian that are directly
  5  8 related to the education of the pupil at a nonpublic school,
  5  9 including a nonpublic school accredited by an independent
  5 10 accrediting agency approved by the department of education, or
  5 11 directly related to providing competent private instruction
  5 12 for the pupil under chapter 299A.  The cost of one computer or
  5 13 other portable computing device shall be allowed as a qualified
  5 14 educational expense for a pupil if such a purchase has not been
  5 15 made using funds from that pupil's account in either of the two
  5 16 immediately preceding fiscal years.
  5 17    b.  "Qualified educational expenses" does not include
  5 18 transportation costs for the pupil, the cost of food or
  5 19 refreshments consumed by the pupil, the cost of clothing for
  5 20 the pupil, or the cost of disposable materials, including
  5 21 but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens, and art
  5 22 supplies.
  5 23    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose
  5 24 of obtaining an education savings grant provided for in
  5 25 this section or who knowingly receives the grant or makes a
  5 26 payment from an account within the education savings grant
  5 27 fund without being legally entitled to do so is guilty of a
  5 28 fraudulent practice under chapter 714.  The false claim for an
  5 29 education savings grant or a payment from an account shall be
  5 30 disallowed. If amounts from the grant have been disbursed from
  5 31 the applicable account in the education savings grant fund, the
  5 32 department of management shall initiate legal proceedings to
  5 33 recover such amounts. A parent or guardian, or a pupil for
  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the
  6  1 education savings grant program in the future.
  6  2    8.  a.  For each pupil with a positive balance in the
  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  6  4 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
  6  5 level of competent private instruction under chapter 299A, the
  6  6 department of management shall maintain the account in the
  6  7 fund until the pupil is twenty=three years of age. Following
  6  8 graduation from high school until the pupil is twenty=three
  6  9 years of age, moneys in the pupil's account may be used
  6 10 for higher education costs, as defined in section 12D.1,
  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.

  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the

  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.

  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings

  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".

  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.

  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.

  4 30 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  4 31 textbooks, fees or payments for educational therapies,

  4 34 matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic online
  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils

  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the

  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon

  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.
  7 13    Sec. 3.  Section 422.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding the
  7 14 following new subsection:
  7 15      1 10 and each succeeding school budget year, the following resident
  1 11 pupils who are attending a nonpublic school, as defined
  1 12 in section 285.16, or who are receiving competent private
  1 13 instruction under chapter 299A shall be eligible to receive an
  1 14 education savings grant in the manner provided in this section:
  1 15    (1)  A pupil eligible to enroll in kindergarten.
  1 16    (2)  A pupil eligible to enroll in grade one through grade
  1 17 twelve if the pupil has attended a public school for the
  1 18 equivalent of the two immediately preceding semesters for which
  1 19 the educational savings grant is requested and if the pupil is
  1 20 not otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 21    (3)  A pupil who received an education savings grant for
  1 22 the immediately preceding school budget year, who is eligible
  1 23 to enroll in grade one through grade twelve, and who is not
  1 24 otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 25    b.  Education savings grants shall be made available to
  1 26 requesting parents and guardians of an eligible pupil each
  1 27 school budget year for the duration of the education savings
  1 28 grant period and in the manner authorized under subsection
  1 29 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  1 30 expenses as provided in this section.
  1 31    c.  For purposes of this subsection, "resident" means the
  1 32 same as defined in section 282.1.
  1 33    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  1 34 which the education savings grant is first requested or the
  1 35 school year following expiration of a previous education
  2  1 savings grant period, the parent or guardian of the pupil
  2  2 requesting to receive an education savings grant shall submit
  2  3 an application to the department of education, on application
  2  4 forms developed by the department, indicating that the parent
  2  5 or guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school
  2  6 or place the pupil under competent private instruction as
  2  7 provided for in chapter 299A.
  2  8    (2)  In addition to such information deemed appropriate by
  2  9 the department of education, the application shall require
  2 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the pupil's
  2 11 enrollment for the following school year or a statement
  2 12 indicating the parent or guardian's intent to place the pupil
  2 13 under competent private instruction for the following school
  2 14 year.
  2 15    b.  An application from the parent or guardian of an
  2 16 eligible pupil shall be approved for the duration of the
  2 17 education savings grant period. Upon submission of a valid
  2 18 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil,
  2 19 the department of education shall enter into a contract with
  2 20 the parent or guardian requiring provision and funding of the
  2 21 education savings grant for each school budget year of the
  2 22 education savings grant period for which the pupil remains
  2 23 eligible under the requirements of this section.  The education
  2 24 savings grant period is five years or the number of years until
  2 25 completion of the school year during which the pupil graduates
  2 26 from high school or completes an equivalent level of competent
  2 27 private instruction under chapter 299A, whichever is less,
  2 28 provided that the parent or guardian may terminate the contract
  2 29 at any time.
  2 30    c.  By March 1 preceding each school year, the department
  2 31 of education shall notify the department of management of the
  2 32 number of pupils designated for the following school year
  2 33 to receive an education savings grant and the amount of the
  2 34 education savings grant for each pupil.  The department of
  2 35 education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3  1 pupils who are approved to receive an education savings grant.
  3  2    3.  a.  The department of management shall assign each
  3  3 pupil an education savings grant in an amount equal to the
  3  4 difference between eighty=seven and five=tenths percent of the
  3  5 regular program state cost per pupil and the statewide average
  3  6 foundation property tax per pupil for the same school year.
  3  7    b.  The department of management shall on July 1 following
  3  8 the determination of the amount of the education savings grant
  3  9 for each approved pupil transfer such amounts to the pupil's
  3 10 account in the education savings grant fund established under
  3 11 subsection 4.  Such amount shall be available to the pupil's
  3 12 parent or guardian in the manner authorized under subsection
  3 13 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  3 14 expenses incurred by such persons for the pupil during that
  3 15 school year or in a future school year pursuant to subsection
  3 16 5, paragraph "c".
  3 17    4.  An education savings grant fund is created in the state
  3 18 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 19 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department of
  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  3 31 administration of the fund.
  3 32    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  3 34    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings
  4  2 grants in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that
  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 17    b.  A nonpublic school or a provider of competent private
  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.
  4 23    c.  Moneys remaining in a pupil's account upon conclusion
  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.
  4 29    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  4 30 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  4 31 textbooks, fees or payments for educational therapies,
  4 32 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  4 33 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific subject
  4 34 matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic online
  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils
  5  1 with disabilities, including the cost of paraprofessionals
  5  2 and assistants who are trained in accordance with state law,
  5  3 standardized test fees, fees required by the department not to
  5  4 exceed for each grant recipient five percent of the total grant
  5  5 amount in any fiscal year, higher education costs, as defined
  5  6 in section 12D.1, excluding room and board expenses, and other
  5  7 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian that are directly
  5  8 related to the education of the pupil at a nonpublic school,
  5  9 including a nonpublic school accredited by an independent
  5 10 accrediting agency approved by the department of education, or
  5 11 directly related to providing competent private instruction
  5 12 for the pupil under chapter 299A.  The cost of one computer or
  5 13 other portable computing device shall be allowed as a qualified
  5 14 educational expense for a pupil if such a purchase has not been
  5 15 made using funds from that pupil's account in either of the two
  5 16 immediately preceding fiscal years.
  5 17    b.  "Qualified educational expenses" does not include
  5 18 transportation costs for the pupil, the cost of food or
  5 19 refreshments consumed by the pupil, the cost of clothing for
  5 20 the pupil, or the cost of disposable materials, including
  5 21 but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens, and art
  5 22 supplies.
  5 23    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose
  5 24 of obtaining an education savings grant provided for in
  5 25 this section or who knowingly receives the grant or makes a
  5 26 payment from an account within the education savings grant
  5 27 fund without being legally entitled to do so is guilty of a
  5 28 fraudulent practice under chapter 714.  The false claim for an
  5 29 education savings grant or a payment from an account shall be
  5 30 disallowed. If amounts from the grant have been disbursed from
  5 31 the applicable account in the education savings grant fund, the
  5 32 department of management shall initiate legal proceedings to
  5 33 recover such amounts. A parent or guardian, or a pupil for
  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the
  6  1 education savings grant program in the future.
  6  2    8.  a.  For each pupil with a positive balance in the
  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  6  4 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
  6  5 level of competent private instruction under chapter 299A, the
  6  6 department of management shall maintain the account in the
  6  7 fund until the pupil is twenty=three years of age. Following
  6  8 graduation from high school until the pupil is twenty=three
  6  9 years of age, moneys in the pupil's account may be used
  6 10 for higher education costs, as defined in section 12D.1,
  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.

  2 21 education savings grant for each school budget year of the
  2 22 education savings grant period for which the pupil remains
  2 23 eligible under the requirements of this section.  The education
  2 24 savings grant period is five years or the number of years until
  2 25 completion of the school year during which the pupil graduates
  2 26 from high school or completes an equivalent level of competent
  2 27 private instruction under chapter 299A, whichever is less,
  2 28 provided that the parent or guardian may terminate the contract
  2 29 at any time.
  2 30    c.  By March 1 preceding each school year, the department
  2 31 of education shall notify the department of management of the
  2 32 number of pupils designated for the following school year
  2 33 to receive an education savings grant and the amount of the
  2 34 education savings grant for each pupil.  The department of
  2 35 education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3  1 pupils who are approved to receive an education savings grant.
  3  2    3.  a.  The department of management shall assign each
  3  3 pupil an education savings grant in an amount equal to the
  3  4 difference between eighty=seven and five=tenths percent of the
  3  5 regular program state cost per pupil and the statewide average
  3  6 foundation property tax per pupil for the same school year.
  3  7    b.  The department of management shall on July 1 following
  3  8 the determination of the amount of the education savings grant
  3  9 for each approved pupil transfer such amounts to the pupil's
  3 10 account in the education savings grant fund established under
  3 11 subsection 4.  Such amount shall be available to the pupil's
  3 12 parent or guardian in the manner authorized under subsection
  3 13 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  3 14 expenses incurred by such persons for the pupil during that
  3 15 school year or in a future school year pursuant to subsection
  3 16 5, paragraph "c".
  3 17    4.  An education savings grant fund is created in the state
  3 18 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 19 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department of
  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  3 31 administration of the fund.
  3 32    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  3 34    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings
  4  2 grants in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that
  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 17    b.  A nonpublic school or a provider of competent private
  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.
  4 23    c.  Moneys remaining in a pupil's account upon conclusion
  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.
  4 29    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  4 30 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  4 31 textbooks, fees or payments for educational therapies,
  4 32 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  4 33 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific subject
  4 34 matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic online
  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils
  5  1 with disabilities, including the cost of paraprofessionals
  5  2 and assistants who are trained in accordance with state law,
  5  3 standardized test fees, fees required by the department not to
  5  4 exceed for each grant recipient five percent of the total grant
  5  5 amount in any fiscal year, higher education costs, as defined
  5  6 in section 12D.1, excluding room and board expenses, and other
  5  7 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian that are directly
  5  8 related to the education of the pupil at a nonpublic school,
  5  9 including a nonpublic school accredited by an independent
  5 10 accrediting agency approved by the department of education, or
  5 11 directly related to providing competent private instruction
  5 12 for the pupil under chapter 299A.  The cost of one computer or
  5 13 other portable computing device shall be allowed as a qualified
  5 14 educational expense for a pupil if such a purchase has not been
  5 15 made using funds from that pupil's account in either of the two
  5 16 immediately preceding fiscal years.
  5 17    b.  "Qualified educational expenses" does not include
  5 18 transportation costs for the pupil, the cost of food or
  5 19 refreshments consumed by the pupil, the cost of clothing for
  5 20 the pupil, or the cost of disposable materials, including
  5 21 but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens, and art
  5 22 supplies.
  5 23    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose
  5 24 of obtaining an education savings grant provided for in
  5 25 this section or who knowingly receives the grant or makes a
  5 26 payment from an account within the education savings grant
  5 27 fund without being legally entitled to do so is guilty of a
  5 28 fraudulent practice under chapter 714.  The false claim for an
  5 29 education savings grant or a payment from an account shall be
  5 30 disallowed. If amounts from the grant have been disbursed from
  5 31 the applicable account in the education savings grant fund, the
  5 32 department of management shall initiate legal proceedings to
  5 33 recover such amounts. A parent or guardian, or a pupil for
  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the
  6  1 education savings grant program in the future.
  6  2    8.  a.  For each pupil with a positive balance in the
  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  6  4 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
  6  5 level of competent private instruction under chapter 299A, the
  6  6 department of management shall maintain the account in the
  6  7 fund until the pupil is twenty=three years of age. Following
  6  8 graduation from high school until the pupil is twenty=three
  6  9 years of age, moneys in the pupil's account may be used
  6 10 for higher education costs, as defined in section 12D.1,
  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.

  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils
  5  1 with disabilities, including the cost of paraprofessionals
  5  2 and assistants who are trained in accordance with state law,
  5  3 standardized test fees, fees required by the department not to
  5  4 exceed for each grant recipient five percent of the total grant
  5  5 amount in any fiscal year, higher education costs, as defined
  5  6 in section 12D.1, excluding room and board expenses, and other
  5  7 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian that are directly
  5  8 related to the education of the pupil at a nonpublic school,
  5  9 including a nonpublic school accredited by an independent
  5 10 accrediting agency approved by the department of education, or
  5 11 directly related to providing competent private instruction
  5 12 for the pupil under chapter 299A.  The cost of one computer or
  5 13 other portable computing device shall be allowed as a qualified
  5 14 educational expense for a pupil if such a purchase has not been
  5 15 made using funds from that pupil's account in either of the two
  5 16 immediately preceding fiscal years.
  5 17    b.  "Qualified educational expenses" does not include
  5 18 transportation costs for the pupil, the cost of food or
  5 19 refreshments consumed by the pupil, the cost of clothing for
  5 20 the pupil, or the cost of disposable materials, including
  5 21 but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens, and art
  5 22 supplies.
  5 23    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose
  5 24 of obtaining an education savings grant provided for in
  5 25 this section or who knowingly receives the grant or makes a
  5 26 payment from an account within the education savings grant
  5 27 fund without being legally entitled to do so is guilty of a
  5 28 fraudulent practice under chapter 714.  The false claim for an
  5 29 education savings grant or a payment from an account shall be
  5 30 disallowed. If amounts from the grant have been disbursed from
  5 31 the applicable account in the education savings grant fund, the
  5 32 department of management shall initiate legal proceedings to
  5 33 recover such amounts. A parent or guardian, or a pupil for
  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the
  6  1 education savings grant program in the future.
  6  2    8.  a.  For each pupil with a positive balance in the
  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  6  4 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
  6  5 level of competent private instruction under chapter 299A, the
  6  6 department of management shall maintain the account in the
  6  7 fund until the pupil is twenty=three years of age. Following
  6  8 graduation from high school until the pupil is twenty=three
  6  9 years of age, moneys in the pupil's account may be used
  6 10 for higher education costs, as defined in section 12D.1,
  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.
  7 13    Sec. 3.  Section 422.7, Code 2018, is amended by adding the
  7 14 following new subsection:
  7 15      1 15    (1)  A pupil eligible to enroll in kindergarten.
  1 16    (2)  A pupil eligible to enroll in grade one through grade
  1 17 twelve if the pupil has attended a public school for the
  1 18 equivalent of the two immediately preceding semesters for which
  1 19 the educational savings grant is requested and if the pupil is
  1 20 not otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 21    (3)  A pupil who received an education savings grant for
  1 22 the immediately preceding school budget year, who is eligible
  1 23 to enroll in grade one through grade twelve, and who is not
  1 24 otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 25    b.  Education savings grants shall be made available to
  1 26 requesting parents and guardians of an eligible pupil each
  1 27 school budget year for the duration of the education savings
  1 28 grant period and in the manner authorized under subsection
  1 29 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  1 30 expenses as provided in this section.
  1 31    c.  For purposes of this subsection, "resident" means the
  1 32 same as defined in section 282.1.
  1 33    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  1 34 which the education savings grant is first requested or the
  1 35 school year following expiration of a previous education
  2  1 savings grant period, the parent or guardian of the pupil
  2  2 requesting to receive an education savings grant shall submit
  2  3 an application to the department of education, on application
  2  4 forms developed by the department, indicating that the parent
  2  5 or guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school
  2  6 or place the pupil under competent private instruction as
  2  7 provided for in chapter 299A.
  2  8    (2)  In addition to such information deemed appropriate by
  2  9 the department of education, the application shall require
  2 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the pupil's
  2 11 enrollment for the following school year or a statement
  2 12 indicating the parent or guardian's intent to place the pupil
  2 13 under competent private instruction for the following school
  2 14 year.
  2 15    b.  An application from the parent or guardian of an
  2 16 eligible pupil shall be approved for the duration of the
  2 17 education savings grant period. Upon submission of a valid
  2 18 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil,
  2 19 the department of education shall enter into a contract with
  2 20 the parent or guardian requiring provision and funding of the
  2 21 education savings grant for each school budget year of the
  2 22 education savings grant period for which the pupil remains
  2 23 eligible under the requirements of this section.  The education
  2 24 savings grant period is five years or the number of years until
  2 25 completion of the school year during which the pupil graduates
  2 26 from high school or completes an equivalent level of competent
  2 27 private instruction under chapter 299A, whichever is less,
  2 28 provided that the parent or guardian may terminate the contract
  2 29 at any time.
  2 30    c.  By March 1 preceding each school year, the department
  2 31 of education shall notify the department of management of the
  2 32 number of pupils designated for the following school year
  2 33 to receive an education savings grant and the amount of the
  2 34 education savings grant for each pupil.  The department of
  2 35 education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3  1 pupils who are approved to receive an education savings grant.
  3  2    3.  a.  The department of management shall assign each
  3  3 pupil an education savings grant in an amount equal to the
  3  4 difference between eighty=seven and five=tenths percent of the
  3  5 regular program state cost per pupil and the statewide average
  3  6 foundation property tax per pupil for the same school year.
  3  7    b.  The department of management shall on July 1 following
  3  8 the determination of the amount of the education savings grant
  3  9 for each approved pupil transfer such amounts to the pupil's
  3 10 account in the education savings grant fund established under
  3 11 subsection 4.  Such amount shall be available to the pupil's
  3 12 parent or guardian in the manner authorized under subsection
  3 13 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  3 14 expenses incurred by such persons for the pupil during that
  3 15 school year or in a future school year pursuant to subsection
  3 16 5, paragraph "c".
  3 17    4.  An education savings grant fund is created in the state
  3 18 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 19 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department of
  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  3 31 administration of the fund.
  3 32    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  3 34    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings
  4  2 grants in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that
  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 17    b.  A nonpublic school or a provider of competent private
  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.
  4 23    c.  Moneys remaining in a pupil's account upon conclusion
  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.

  1 21    (3)  A pupil who received an education savings grant for
  1 22 the immediately preceding school budget year, who is eligible
  1 23 to enroll in grade one through grade twelve, and who is not
  1 24 otherwise ineligible under this section.
  1 25    b.  Education savings grants shall be made available to
  1 26 requesting parents and guardians of an eligible pupil each
  1 27 school budget year for the duration of the education savings
  1 28 grant period and in the manner authorized under subsection
  1 29 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  1 30 expenses as provided in this section.
  1 31    c.  For purposes of this subsection, "resident" means the
  1 32 same as defined in section 282.1.
  1 33    2.  a.  (1)  By January 31 preceding the school year for
  1 34 which the education savings grant is first requested or the
  1 35 school year following expiration of a previous education
  2  1 savings grant period, the parent or guardian of the pupil
  2  2 requesting to receive an education savings grant shall submit
  2  3 an application to the department of education, on application
  2  4 forms developed by the department, indicating that the parent
  2  5 or guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school
  2  6 or place the pupil under competent private instruction as
  2  7 provided for in chapter 299A.
  2  8    (2)  In addition to such information deemed appropriate by
  2  9 the department of education, the application shall require
  2 10 certification from the nonpublic school of the pupil's
  2 11 enrollment for the following school year or a statement
  2 12 indicating the parent or guardian's intent to place the pupil
  2 13 under competent private instruction for the following school
  2 14 year.
  2 15    b.  An application from the parent or guardian of an
  2 16 eligible pupil shall be approved for the duration of the
  2 17 education savings grant period. Upon submission of a valid
  2 18 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil,
  2 19 the department of education shall enter into a contract with
  2 20 the parent or guardian requiring provision and funding of the
  2 21 education savings grant for each school budget year of the
  2 22 education savings grant period for which the pupil remains
  2 23 eligible under the requirements of this section.  The education
  2 24 savings grant period is five years or the number of years until
  2 25 completion of the school year during which the pupil graduates
  2 26 from high school or completes an equivalent level of competent
  2 27 private instruction under chapter 299A, whichever is less,
  2 28 provided that the parent or guardian may terminate the contract
  2 29 at any time.
  2 30    c.  By March 1 preceding each school year, the department
  2 31 of education shall notify the department of management of the
  2 32 number of pupils designated for the following school year
  2 33 to receive an education savings grant and the amount of the
  2 34 education savings grant for each pupil.  The department of
  2 35 education shall also notify the parent or guardian of such
  3  1 pupils who are approved to receive an education savings grant.
  3  2    3.  a.  The department of management shall assign each
  3  3 pupil an education savings grant in an amount equal to the
  3  4 difference between eighty=seven and five=tenths percent of the
  3  5 regular program state cost per pupil and the statewide average
  3  6 foundation property tax per pupil for the same school year.
  3  7    b.  The department of management shall on July 1 following
  3  8 the determination of the amount of the education savings grant
  3  9 for each approved pupil transfer such amounts to the pupil's
  3 10 account in the education savings grant fund established under
  3 11 subsection 4.  Such amount shall be available to the pupil's
  3 12 parent or guardian in the manner authorized under subsection
  3 13 4, paragraph "c", for the payment of qualified educational
  3 14 expenses incurred by such persons for the pupil during that
  3 15 school year or in a future school year pursuant to subsection
  3 16 5, paragraph "c".
  3 17    4.  An education savings grant fund is created in the state
  3 18 treasury under the control of the department of management
  3 19 consisting of moneys appropriated to the department of
  3 20 management for the purpose of providing education savings
  3 21 grants under this section.  For the fiscal year commencing July
  3 22 1, 2019, and each succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated
  3 23 from the general fund of the state to the department of
  3 24 management to be credited to the fund the amount necessary
  3 25 to pay all education savings grants approved for that fiscal
  3 26 year.  The director of the department of management has all
  3 27 powers necessary to carry out and effectuate the purposes,
  3 28 objectives, and provisions of this section pertaining to the
  3 29 fund, including the power to do all of the following:
  3 30    a.  Make and enter into contracts necessary for the
  3 31 administration of the fund.
  3 32    b.  Procure insurance against any loss in connection with the
  3 33 assets of the fund or require a surety bond.
  3 34    c.  Contract with a private financial management firm to
  3 35 manage the fund, in collaboration with the treasurer of state,
  4  1 including providing for the disbursement of education savings
  4  2 grants in the form of an electronic debit card or checks that
  4  3 are payable directly from the pupil's account within the fund.
  4  4    d.  Conduct audits or other review necessary to properly
  4  5 administer the program.
  4  6    e.  Adopt rules for the administration of the fund and
  4  7 accounts within the fund.
  4  8    5.  a.  For each pupil approved for an education savings
  4  9 grant, the department of management shall establish an account
  4 10 for that pupil in the education savings grant fund.  The amount
  4 11 of the pupil's education savings grant shall be deposited
  4 12 into the pupil's account on July 1, and such amount shall be
  4 13 immediately available for the payment of qualified educational
  4 14 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  4 15 during that fiscal year using the payment method authorized
  4 16 under subsection 4, paragraph "c".
  4 17    b.  A nonpublic school or a provider of competent private
  4 18 instruction under chapter 299A that accepts payment from a
  4 19 parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account in the
  4 20 education savings grant fund shall not refund, rebate, or share
  4 21 any portion of such payment with the parent, guardian, or
  4 22 pupil.
  4 23    c.  Moneys remaining in a pupil's account upon conclusion
  4 24 of the fiscal year shall remain in the pupil's account in the
  4 25 education savings grant fund for the payment of qualified
  4 26 educational expenses in future fiscal years during which the
  4 27 pupil participates in the program or for the payment of higher
  4 28 education costs as provided under subsection 8.
  4 29    6.  a.  For purposes of this section, "qualified educational
  4 30 expenses" includes tuition and fees at a nonpublic school,
  4 31 textbooks, fees or payments for educational therapies,
  4 32 including tutoring or cognitive skills training, curriculum
  4 33 fees and materials for a course of study for a specific subject
  4 34 matter or grade level, tuition or fees for nonpublic online
  4 35 education programs, education materials and services for pupils
  5  1 with disabilities, including the cost of paraprofessionals
  5  2 and assistants who are trained in accordance with state law,
  5  3 standardized test fees, fees required by the department not to
  5  4 exceed for each grant recipient five percent of the total grant
  5  5 amount in any fiscal year, higher education costs, as defined
  5  6 in section 12D.1, excluding room and board expenses, and other
  5  7 expenses incurred by the parent or guardian that are directly
  5  8 related to the education of the pupil at a nonpublic school,
  5  9 including a nonpublic school accredited by an independent
  5 10 accrediting agency approved by the department of education, or
  5 11 directly related to providing competent private instruction
  5 12 for the pupil under chapter 299A.  The cost of one computer or
  5 13 other portable computing device shall be allowed as a qualified
  5 14 educational expense for a pupil if such a purchase has not been
  5 15 made using funds from that pupil's account in either of the two
  5 16 immediately preceding fiscal years.
  5 17    b.  "Qualified educational expenses" does not include
  5 18 transportation costs for the pupil, the cost of food or
  5 19 refreshments consumed by the pupil, the cost of clothing for
  5 20 the pupil, or the cost of disposable materials, including
  5 21 but not limited to paper, notebooks, pencils, pens, and art
  5 22 supplies.
  5 23    7.  A person who makes a false claim for the purpose
  5 24 of obtaining an education savings grant provided for in
  5 25 this section or who knowingly receives the grant or makes a
  5 26 payment from an account within the education savings grant
  5 27 fund without being legally entitled to do so is guilty of a
  5 28 fraudulent practice under chapter 714.  The false claim for an
  5 29 education savings grant or a payment from an account shall be
  5 30 disallowed. If amounts from the grant have been disbursed from
  5 31 the applicable account in the education savings grant fund, the
  5 32 department of management shall initiate legal proceedings to
  5 33 recover such amounts. A parent or guardian, or a pupil for
  5 34 purposes of subsection 8, who commits a fraudulent practice
  5 35 under this section is prohibited from participating in the
  6  1 education savings grant program in the future.
  6  2    8.  a.  For each pupil with a positive balance in the
  6  3 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  6  4 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
  6  5 level of competent private instruction under chapter 299A, the
  6  6 department of management shall maintain the account in the
  6  7 fund until the pupil is twenty=three years of age. Following
  6  8 graduation from high school until the pupil is twenty=three
  6  9 years of age, moneys in the pupil's account may be used
  6 10 for higher education costs, as defined in section 12D.1,
  6 11 incurred by the pupil while attending an institution of higher
  6 12 education under the control of the state board of regents, a
  6 13 community college located in this state, or a private college
  6 14 or university located in this state. Payments from a pupil's
  6 15 account for higher education costs shall be made in the same
  6 16 manner as payments for qualified educational expenses under
  6 17 subsection 5. Moneys in a pupil's account when the pupil
  6 18 turns twenty=three years of age shall be transferred by the
  6 19 department of management for deposit in the general fund of the
  6 20 state.
  6 21    b.  Notwithstanding the age limitation in paragraph "a",
  6 22 if the pupil with a positive balance in the pupil's account
  6 23 in the education savings grant fund upon graduation from high
  6 24 school or completion of an equivalent level of competent
  6 25 private instruction under chapter 299A serves on federal active
  6 26 duty, other than training, and is discharged under honorable
  6 27 conditions, the limitation date otherwise applicable under
  6 28 paragraph "a" shall be extended by one year for each year of
  6 29 federal active duty service by the pupil, but not to a date
  6 30 after the pupil's twenty=seventh birthday.
  6 31    9.  This section shall not be construed to authorize the
  6 32 state or any political subdivision of the state to exercise
  6 33 authority over any nonpublic school or provider of competent
  6 34 private instruction under chapter 299A or construed to require
  6 35 a nonpublic school or provider of competent private instruction
  7  1 under chapter 299A to modify its academic standards for
  7  2 admission or educational program in order to receive payment
  7  3 from a parent or guardian using funds from a pupil's account
  7  4 in the education savings grant fund. A nonpublic school or
  7  5 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7  6 that accepts payment from a parent or guardian using funds
  7  7 from a pupil's account in the education savings grant fund is
  7  8 not an agent of this state or of a political subdivision of
  7  9 this state. Rules adopted by the department to implement this
  7 10 section that impose an undue burden on a nonpublic school or
  7 11 provider of competent private instruction under chapter 299A
  7 12 are invalid.
