  7 25    The section of this Act enacting section 422.7, subsection
  7 26 51.
  7 27                           EXPLANATION
  7 28 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  7 29 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  7 30    This bill establishes an education savings grant program
  7 31 for pupils attending a nonpublic school or receiving competent
  7 32 private instruction and establishes an education savings grant
  7 33 fund.
  7 34    For the school budget year beginning July 1, 2019,
  7 35 and each succeeding school budget year, resident pupils
  8  1 who are attending a nonpublic school or who are receiving
  8  2 competent private instruction are eligible to receive an
  8  3 education savings grant if the pupil is eligible to enroll in
  8  4 kindergarten, is eligible to enroll in grade 1 through grade 12
  8  5 and has attended a public school for the equivalent of the two
  8  6 immediately preceding semesters, or if the pupil received an
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  7 17 received by the taxpayer for payment of qualified educational
  7 18 expenses.
  7 19    Sec. 4.  APPLICABILITY.  The following apply to school budget
  7 20 years and fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019:
  7 21    1.  The section of this Act amending section 256.7.
  7 22    2.  The section of this Act enacting section 257.11B.
  7 23    Sec. 5.  APPLICABILITY.  The following applies to tax years
  7 24 beginning on or after January 1, 2019:
  7 25    The section of this Act enacting section 422.7, subsection
  7 26 51.

  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  7 21    1.  The section of this Act amending section 256.7.
  7 22    2.  The section of this Act enacting section 257.11B.
  7 23    Sec. 5.  APPLICABILITY.  The following applies to tax years
  7 24 beginning on or after January 1, 2019:
  7 25    The section of this Act enacting section 422.7, subsection
  7 26 51.
  7 27                           EXPLANATION
  7 28 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  7 29 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  7 30    This bill establishes an education savings grant program
  7 31 for pupils attending a nonpublic school or receiving competent
  7 32 private instruction and establishes an education savings grant
  7 33 fund.
  7 34    For the school budget year beginning July 1, 2019,
  7 35 and each succeeding school budget year, resident pupils
  8  1 who are attending a nonpublic school or who are receiving
  8  2 competent private instruction are eligible to receive an
  8  3 education savings grant if the pupil is eligible to enroll in
  8  4 kindergarten, is eligible to enroll in grade 1 through grade 12
  8  5 and has attended a public school for the equivalent of the two
  8  6 immediately preceding semesters, or if the pupil received an
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87

  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  7 26 51.
  7 27                           EXPLANATION
  7 28 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
  7 29 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
  7 30    This bill establishes an education savings grant program
  7 31 for pupils attending a nonpublic school or receiving competent
  7 32 private instruction and establishes an education savings grant
  7 33 fund.
  7 34    For the school budget year beginning July 1, 2019,
  7 35 and each succeeding school budget year, resident pupils
  8  1 who are attending a nonpublic school or who are receiving
  8  2 competent private instruction are eligible to receive an
  8  3 education savings grant if the pupil is eligible to enroll in
  8  4 kindergarten, is eligible to enroll in grade 1 through grade 12
  8  5 and has attended a public school for the equivalent of the two
  8  6 immediately preceding semesters, or if the pupil received an
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  7 31 for pupils attending a nonpublic school or receiving competent
  7 32 private instruction and establishes an education savings grant
  7 33 fund.
  7 34    For the school budget year beginning July 1, 2019,
  7 35 and each succeeding school budget year, resident pupils
  8  1 who are attending a nonpublic school or who are receiving
  8  2 competent private instruction are eligible to receive an
  8  3 education savings grant if the pupil is eligible to enroll in
  8  4 kindergarten, is eligible to enroll in grade 1 through grade 12
  8  5 and has attended a public school for the equivalent of the two
  8  6 immediately preceding semesters, or if the pupil received an
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys

 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the

 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  8  1 who are attending a nonpublic school or who are receiving
  8  2 competent private instruction are eligible to receive an
  8  3 education savings grant if the pupil is eligible to enroll in
  8  4 kindergarten, is eligible to enroll in grade 1 through grade 12
  8  5 and has attended a public school for the equivalent of the two
  8  6 immediately preceding semesters, or if the pupil received an
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  8  7 education savings grant for the immediately preceding school
  8  8 budget year.  By January 31 preceding the school year for which
  8  9 the education savings grant is first requested or the school
  8 10 year following expiration of a previous education savings grant
  8 11 period, the parent or guardian of the pupil requesting to
  8 12 receive an education savings grant must submit an application
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.

  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  8 13 to the department of education indicating that the parent or
  8 14 guardian intends to enroll the pupil in a nonpublic school or
  8 15 place the pupil under competent private instruction.
  8 16    The bill requires that by March 1 preceding each school
  8 17 year, the department of education must notify the department
  8 18 of management of the number of pupils designated for the
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.

  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.

 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  8 19 following school year to receive an education savings grant and
  8 20 the amount of the education savings grant for each pupil.  An
  8 21 application from the parent or guardian of an eligible pupil
  8 22 shall be approved for the duration of the education savings
  8 23 grant period and the department of education shall enter into a
  8 24 contract with the parent or guardian requiring provision and
  8 25 funding of the education savings grant for each school budget
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.
       LSB 5674XS (3) 87
       md/jh
  8 26 year of the education savings grant period for which the pupil
  8 27 remains eligible.  The education savings grant period is five
  8 28 years or the number of years until completion of the school
  8 29 year during which the pupil graduates from high school or
  8 30 completes an equivalent level of competent private instruction,
  8 31 whichever is less, provided that the parent or guardian may
  8 32 terminate the contract at any time.
  8 33    The amount of each education savings grant is equal to the
  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state
  8 35 cost per pupil and the statewide average foundation property
  9  1 tax per pupil in the same school year.
  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

  8 34 difference between 87.5 percent of the regular program state

  9  2    The bill creates an education savings grant fund in
  9  3 the state treasury under the control of the department of
  9  4 management consisting of moneys appropriated to the department
  9  5 of management for the purpose of providing education savings
  9  6 grants.  For the fiscal year commencing July 1, 2019, and each
  9  7 succeeding fiscal year, there is appropriated from the general
  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.
  9 20    The bill authorizes the department of education to
  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.
  9 27    The bill provides that moneys remaining in a pupil's account
  9 28 upon the conclusion of the fiscal year shall remain in the
  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.

  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

  9  8 fund of the state to the department of management for deposit
  9  9 in the fund the amount necessary to pay all education savings
  9 10 grants approved for that fiscal year.  For each pupil approved
  9 11 for an education savings grant, the department of management
  9 12 must establish an account for that pupil in the education
  9 13 savings grant fund.  The amount of the pupil's education
  9 14 savings grant is deposited into the pupil's account on July 1
  9 15 and such amount is available for use by parents and guardians
  9 16 for the payment of qualified educational expenses, as defined
  9 17 in the bill, incurred by the parent or guardian for the pupil
  9 18 during that fiscal year or in a future fiscal year as provided
  9 19 in the bill.

  9 21 contract with a private financial management firm to manage
  9 22 the education savings grant fund, in collaboration with the
  9 23 treasurer of state, including providing for the disbursement
  9 24 of education savings grants in the form of an electronic debit
  9 25 card or checks that are payable directly from the pupil's
  9 26 account within the fund.

  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.

  9 29 pupil's account in the education savings grant fund for the
  9 30 payment of qualified educational expenses in future fiscal
  9 31 years during which the pupil participates in the program or for
  9 32 higher education costs as authorized in the bill.
  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.
 10 18    The bill provides that an education savings grant received
 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
 10 20 individual income taxation. This provision of the bill applies
 10 21 to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2019.
 10 22    The sections of the bill amending Code section 256.7 and
 10 23 enacting Code section 257.11B apply to school budget years and
 10 24 fiscal years beginning on or after July 1, 2019.

  9 33    Under the bill, for each pupil with a positive balance in
  9 34 the pupil's account in the education savings grant fund upon
  9 35 graduation from high school or completion of an equivalent
 10  1 level of competent private instruction under Code chapter
 10  2 299A, the department of management is required to maintain the
 10  3 account in the fund until the pupil reaches an age specified in
 10  4 the bill.  Until the pupil reaches the age limitation, moneys
 10  5 in the pupil's account may be used by the pupil for higher
 10  6 education costs, as defined in Code section 12D.1.  Moneys in a
 10  7 pupil's account when the pupil reaches the age limitation are
 10  8 transferred by the department of management for deposit in the
 10  9 general fund of the state.
 10 10    The bill provides that a person who makes a false claim for
 10 11 the purpose of obtaining an education savings grant or who
 10 12 knowingly receives the grant or makes a payment from an account
 10 13 in the education savings grant fund without being legally
 10 14 entitled to do so is guilty of a fraudulent practice and is
 10 15 subject to a criminal penalty.  The bill allows the department
 10 16 of management to initiate legal proceedings to recover grants
 10 17 and amounts improperly awarded or paid.

 10 19 by a taxpayer is not taxable income for purposes of state
